title: add more explanation on the `class vs React.createClass vs stateless` section
body: Normal function component has 1 kB smaller weight than class-based one (it could be noticed on the final bundle size), so more components built as normal functions - the smaller bundle size will be.

title: Is there CONTRIBUTING.md
body:
I made PR #1295 and you overwrote my commit message. I think we need a rule for commit message to avoid overwriting commit messages. If there is the rule, it could be good for contributors. For example, we need create the rule like below:

- [Tests]  ~ for test
- [eslint config] ~ for eslint rule
- [guide][react] ~ for gude ? 

What do you think ?

title: Code Failure when adding trailing comma to function arguments.
Fix broken links

title: Adds CaseNine to In the Wild on README.md
body: CaseNine is now using Airbnb's style guide and would like to be added to the In The Wild list.

title: why don't use collection.length
Replace eslint-plugin-react with eslint-plugin-inferno?
body:
Hi,

I want to use [eslint-config-airbnb](https://www.npmjs.com/package/eslint-config-airbnb) but also want to use [Inferno](https://www.infernojs.org) instead of [React](https://facebook.github.io/react/).

Unfortunately `eslint-config-airbnb` depends on `eslint-plugin-react`. Is there an easy way where I can replace `eslint-plugin-react` with `eslint-plugin-inferno` and everything works as expected?

title: Update a11y removed rules and dependecy.
body: Closes #1290

title: Update a11y removed rules and dependecy.
body: As found in related issue https://github.com/evcohen/eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y/issues/175 with the latest 4.0 release the a11y plugin changed some rules.

title: Added documentation for 8.4
body: Added explanation for using parentheses with explicit returns and alternatives with the eslint "always" option.

title: [guide] Use const in README when not reassigning reference
body:
According to the section [2.2](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript#references--prefer-const) of the guide, `const` is preferred.

This change contributes to the internal consistency.

title: Change function order in functions (7.1) example
body:
Part 7.1 says first why function declarations are not good and
after that it recommends to give a name to function expression.
The same order could be used in example too.

title: Use eslint-plugin-es5 for ES5 config
body:
If users set `es5` config, in my opinion, they want to write on ES5. So we should warn them about ES6 features, because they could brake IE/Safari.

There is a special plugin for ES5: https://github.com/nkt/eslint-plugin-es5

Should we use it?

title: Generator/coroutine: "Missing function expression name (func-names)"
Unmet peer dependency
body:
`npm i eslint-config-airbnb --save-dev`

>├─┬ eslint-config-airbnb@14.0.0 
>│ ├── eslint-config-airbnb-base@11.0.1 
>│ └── UNMET PEER DEPENDENCY eslint-plugin-import@^2.2.0
>├── UNMET PEER DEPENDENCY eslint-plugin-import@^2.2.0
>├── UNMET PEER DEPENDENCY eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y@^3.0.2
>└── UNMET PEER DEPENDENCY eslint-plugin-react@^6.9.0

Why is it broken?

title: Atom beautification config.
body:
The default rules for the "atom-beautify" does not play very well with the airbnb eslint config rules. Also, the config options available are also not enough to be tuned.

Is there a plugin or config options available for auto beautification in atom while still maintaining the consistency of airbnb eslint rules.

title: Where to place operators in a multi-line ternary?
body:
My team uses airbnb's styleguide as our default for coding style, although we do deviate occasionally.

Does airbnb have an opinion on where the operators should go in a multi-line ternary?

It's not specifically talked about anywhere, but there is the example:
```
// better
const foo = maybe1 > maybe2
  ? 'bar'
  : maybeNull;
```

one of our engs prefers this, with the justification that it's easier to read. If you read the first line by itself, then having the `?` at the end lets you know that this is a ternary and is continuing. Otherwise, if you're skimming the code very fast, you might think that you're assigning `foo` a boolean value.
```
const foo = maybe1 > maybe2 ?
  'bar' :
  maybeNull;
```

And again, we're using multi-line ternaries because we have some long expressions and values to be assigned.

title: eslint config validation error installing 14.0.0
body:
Platform: OSX
NPM: 3.10.8
Node: 6.9.1

Having upgraded to 14.0.0 using the recommend approach for OSX on npm.org

```
(
  export PKG=eslint-config-airbnb;
  npm info "$PKG@latest" peerDependencies --json | command sed 's/[\{\},]//g ; s/: /@/g' | xargs npm install --save-dev "$PKG@latest"
)
```

I'm getting config validator errors running eslint -

```bash
Error: /Users/steve.gibbings/WebstormProjects/wcp-core/wordpress/themes/node_modules/eslint-config-airbnb-base/rules/es6.js:
        Configuration for rule "arrow-parens" is invalid:
        Value "as-needed,[object Object]" has more items than allowed.
```

I've double checked the dependency versions that are installed -

```json
    "eslint": "^3.14.0",
    "eslint-config-airbnb": "^14.0.0",
    "eslint-plugin-import": "^2.2.0",
    "eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y": "^3.0.2",
    "eslint-plugin-react": "^6.9.0",
```

matching -

```
$:npm info "eslint-config-airbnb@latest" peerDependencies
 
{ eslint: '^3.13.0',
  'eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y': '^3.0.2',
  'eslint-plugin-import': '^2.2.0',
  'eslint-plugin-react': '^6.9.0' }
```

There is an npm warning -

```
npm WARN eslint-config-airbnb-base@5.0.3 requires a peer of eslint-plugin-import@^1.13.0 but none was installed.
```

as 2.2.0 is installed.

What I'm getting installed from that package.json devDeps are -

eslint: 3.14.0
eslint-config-airbnb: 14.0.0
eslint-config-airbnb-base: 5.0.3
eslint-plugin-import: 2.2.0

Feels like I have a mismatch of packages somewhere.

Any ideas please?

title: Contradiction in Functions  guide
body:
Reading through the guide on Github and the guide on airbnb.io there seems to be a contradiction in the functions part.

https://github.com/airbnb/javascript#functions
http://airbnb.io/javascript/#functions

Which one is preferred and why?

title: how can we stop a `nodejs` server started?
body:
hello,

>  node server.js>node.log &

i use the `proc_open` function to execute the cmd

now is there a way to stop it,althought i use the `proc_close` function but it still running,i try the `exec('kill'.PID);` too but it's not stoped att all ,how can i do it?

title: Documentation/docblocks
body:
I am wondering why there is no section of documentation or docblocks. Is it conventional to leave them out? What is the reason I don't see any docblocks in the open-sourced projects you guys have?

I would love to hear thoughts about using docblocks in Javascript. I find them really helpful when I am programming PHP. Especially if your IDE has support for it and can help you out with the documentation.

title: Export-ing conventions
External callback function
[guide] README update for JSCS deprecated links
body:
Created pull request after receiving permission from this created issue: https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/issues/1272

Just letting people know up front that the JSCS style guides are deprecated and to use the eslint style guides from now on.

title: README update for JSCS deprecated links
body:
I noticed that the JSCS links in the README.md file currently link to the deprecated JSCS github pages.  There should probably be something that states that these are deprecated and where to find the documentation for es6 and es5-deprecated eslint.

The README files on:
https://github.com/airbnb/javascript

Should have the following added to the end of the 'JSCS - Airbnb Style Preset':
(Depricated, please use [ESlint](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/tree/master/packages/eslint-config-airbnb-base))

---

The README file on:
https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/tree/es5-deprecated/es5

Should have the following added to the end of the 'JSCS - Airbnb Style Preset':
(Depricated, please use [ESlint](https://github.com/airbnb/javascript/tree/master/packages/eslint-config-airbnb-base#eslint-config-airbnb-baselegacy))

title: Using 'ForOfStatement' is not allowed (no-restricted-syntax)
body:
Hi,
Since everybody tell us to not use forEach() but use for loop instead because it is much faster  (https://jsperf.com/test-if-using-forofstatement-is-not-allowed-makes-sens), I would like to know why this is not allowed by airbnb ?
